intro: Dorstenia holstii var. holstii, commonly known as the "tongue of the sky" or "star-shaped" plant, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, star-like flowers that open in the evening and close during the day. The plant features fleshy, spiral-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
